refsynopsisdiv.title: Calling Sequence
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: M = cummax(A) M = cummax(A,dim) M = cummax(_,direction)

listitem.para:
positive integer value
For complex elements, cummax compares the magnitude of elements. If the magnitude are same, phase angles are compared.

Dimension to operate along
If no dimension is specified, then the default value is the first array dimension whose value is greater than 1

Direction of cumulation
If the direction is forward, cummax works from 1 to end of the active dimension. Otherwise, it works in the opposite sense

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The function returns the cumulative maximum elements of the input vector/array.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting:
Cumulative maximum values in a vector v = [8 9 1 10 6 1 3 6 10 10] M = cummax(v)
//Expected output: [8 9 9 10 10 10 10 10 10 10]
